description: frowning; medium length beard; leaf headband around head; furrowed brow; grey/ brown unfinished marble base (not attached); iron mounting rod inserted in bottom
text:
The emperor Diocletian was born in Dalmatia of slave parents. He entered the army and rose through the ranks because of his superior abilities. His fellow soldiers proclaimed him emperor in 284 A.D. Diocletian attempted to reorganize the vast empire into four administrative districts, each controlled by a supreme governor, or tetrarch. This four-ruler system was called the tetrarchia. This form of provincial rule essentially remained in force for many years, and Diocletian's socio-economic legislation had far-reaching consequences in the ancient world. Diocletian also tried to reintroduce the pagan religion by assuming the title Jovius (in homage to Jupiter), and by starting new persecutions against the Christians, whom he regarded as a disruptive element.

This head wears a heavy oak wreath, a form of commemoration used in Roman imperial portraiture. Here, it may also allude to Diocletian's association with Jupiter.
title: Portrait Head of the Emperor Diocletian
